content: yarn café creations vanilla soufflé a sock pattern by christy houghton copyright 2019 yarn café creations christy houghton all rights reserved in downloading this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use you may not distribute or sell electronic or paper copies of this pattern you can contact the designer at yarncafecreations@gmail com vanilla soufflé by christy houghton 2 gather your stuff pattern sizes this pattern is for women s shoe sizes 5 - 5 ½ 6 - 6 ½ 7 7 ½ 8 8 ½ 9 9 ½ xs s m l xl yarn needed color a approximately 60 grams/262 yards 70 grams/305 yards 80 grams/350 yards 90 grams/393 yards 100 grams/437 yards of a solid tonal or lightly speckled colorway in a fingering weight yarn recommended yarn yarn café creations 75% superwash merino wool / 20% nylon / 5% lurex fingering weight sock yarn 437 yards /100 grams colorway shown in picture octavia needles used four us size 0 2 00 mm double pointed needles dpns 5 - 6 in length and four us size 1 2 25 mm dpns 5 -6 in length you can also use 9 circular needles in these two sizes or 24 40 circulars if using magic loop method instructions are written for dpns you may need to go up needle sizes to obtain gauge notions needed tapestry needle stitch marker scissors gauge approximately 28 sts = 4 45 rounds = 4 gauge was measured in stockinette on us size 1 2 25 mm dpns knitting terms and abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on p purl decrease decrease p2tog purl 2 together k knit pm place marker kfb knit in the front and the back of the same stitch round s rounds k2tog knit 2 stitches together st s stitch es m marker ssk slip slip knit notes this pattern uses a gusset heel feel free to insert a different type of heel if you are comfortable doing so gauge is measured in stockinette stitch section 1 the cuff using smaller needles co 52 56 60 64 68 stitches and divide onto three dpns as follows size xs needle one 16 sts needle two 20 sts needle three 16 sts size s needle one 20 sts needle two 16 sts needle three 20 sts size m needle one 20 sts needle two 20 sts needle three 20 sts size l needle one 20 sts needle two 24 sts needle three 20 sts size xl needle one 24 sts needle two 20 sts needle three 24 sts place marker only needed if knitting on 9 circulars and join to knit in the round you will slip the marker if using one before beginning each round row 1 * k2 tbl p2 * repeat from * to * to end of row row 2 20 repeat row one you can adjust the height of the cuff to your liking by doing more or fewer row section
